meanings.sent1: The cake was divided into quintiles, so each person got an equal piece.
meanings.sent2: In statistics, quintiles help analyze data by splitting it into five equal sections.
meanings.sent3: At the party, they played a game where each team represented a quintile of the rainbow.
meanings.sent4: The school's spirit was divided into quintiles, with each section shining brightly.
meanings.sent5: The garden was split into quintiles, each flourishing with different flowers.

meanings.definition: A value that divides a set of data into five equal parts.
meanings.sent1: The quintiles of the test scores showed a clear distribution among the students.
meanings.sent2: Economists often use quintiles to understand income distribution in a population.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the quintiles of spice in the dish were perfectly balanced.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, breaking the tension into quintiles of relief.
meanings.sent5: The music festival showcased quintiles of talent, each performer bringing something unique.
